file_content.text: We will be arriving on Dromund Kaas shortly. Please proceed to disembark.
Welcome back. I'm pleased to see that you have returned whole.
I do apologize for the condition of the bridge. As I'd intended to explain earlier, there was an incident.
There are corpses all over the floor. This is what you call an "incident"?
That's an understatement.
What's this?
You'd better tell me what happened, or I'm going to be very unhappy.
Explain now.
Several of the crew were extremely agitated by your behavior. Ensign Hetter feared you might execute anyone who failed to contribute to the mission.
A group of officers attempted to flee the ship before you returned. Lieutenant Sylas objected, and a firefight broke out.
There was a large number of casualties. But don't worry--I'm fully capable of piloting the ship back to Dromund Kaas.
You're telling me they panicked and killed one another?
The crew did this?
That is correct. It was unexpected.
So now what?
Couldn't you have stopped them?
That's horrible.
I saw no effective way to intervene.
Grand Moff Kilran is eagerly awaiting your report. Shall I put him through?
Go ahead. There's no sense waiting.
Very well.
With the crew dead, I suppose there's not much left to do.
Guess we should.
It's your command again. Make the call.
Your choice, Captain.
Put the Grand Moff through.
Be my guest.
Opening channel now.
Well--how fortunate I could reach my friends aboard the Black Talon.
The droid's been keeping me apprised of your work, but I very much wanted to hear from you. How did the attack go?
The Brentaal Star has been disabled and the general captured. He'll be in your hands soon.
Mission successful.
Excellent. I'll let Korriban and Imperial Intelligence fight over him.
The Brentaal Star has been disabled, and the general is dead.
The mission was successful.
A pity you couldn't bring him back alive--but really, it makes little difference.
What's to hear? I did what you wanted.
There's not much to say.
Please respond appropriately to the Grand Moff.
Please--I'm in good cheer. There's no need for poisonings tonight.
There was a lot of blood shed today, Kilran. I hope it was worth it.
It was sadly violent.
Oh, I'm quite certain it was. Blood is cheap, after all.
You should be proud. This is only one of many operations we're conducting across the galaxy; it's a new beginning to the war.
The general was one of the greatest weapons the Republic had--a defector!--and you've snatched him from enemy hands. I'll remember this, and I'll make sure you're rewarded.
It is an honor to strike a blow against our enemies.
It was my privilege.
You'll strike many more in the future, I'm certain. Darth Baras will be pleased.
It livened up the journey. I appreciate the distraction.
It was diverting.
Ah, yes. When military strategy and Sith entertainments combine, it's surely a good day.
I'm glad I could assist, sir.
Pleased to help.
So dutiful. I wish I had more soldiers with your attitude.
No trouble. This is how I make my living.
It's my job.
Of course. And the Empire can always use more dedicated mercenaries.
Make sure I get credit.
I'll make sure your heroism is mentioned when I report to the other Moffs.
Don't involve me again.
We'll see about that if the day comes, won't we?
But my words hardly matter. Soon you'll be joining us on the homeworld, and you can see for yourself what you've been fighting for.
It should be inspiring. Enjoy the rest of your journey; Kilran out.
Well--the heroes of the day return.
Well--the hero of the day returns.
Welcome back, my lord.
Welcome back, sir.
My men will take the general to the brig. Congratulations. I never expected the mission to go off this cleanly.
Indeed. I had my doubts, but you pulled this mission off.
No problem.
I've no doubt. You've shown impressive judgment.
You're very chipper.
What's not to be pleased about? You spared my life, and we eliminated an enemy of the Empire.
Don't ever underestimate me again, Captain. Next time, it might not work out so well for you.
Fool.
I understand. You gave me a chance--you have my eternal gratitude for that.
This is protocol unit NR-02. If you are receiving this message, I urge you to return to the Black Talon as quickly as possible.
Explain yourself. What's going on?
Talk.
Oh?
There has been an incident aboard the bridge. Your tactics have inspired--
I'm going.
Excellent. Please be advised that there has been an incident aboard the bridge--
Idiots! You'll get us damn well killed!
This is protocol unit NR-02. I hope you're receiving this message clearly, and that your flight was free of incident.
Please hold for security coordinator Ensign Brukarra.
The marines are on their way. They'll follow you in and hold each junction you secure.
Try not to take too long--we're not a military ship. What you have is all you're getting.
I'm not interested in excuses. If I need more marines, you'll pick up a blaster yourself.
That's insufficient.
Understood.
I don't need an army. I can handle this myself.
Reinforcements are pointless.
Yes, but I--I understand.
I've been scanning the Brentaal Star's communications, and security forces appear to be moving to protect the escape pods.
It is extremely likely that the crew is attempting to evacuate the general. You must retrieve or eliminate him before he escapes.
We'll have the general before the crew knows what's happening.
I'll take him.
Got it.
Excellent news.
I don't need a droid telling me how to do things.
Quiet, machine.
Understood. I'm simply looking after Grand Moff Kilran's interests.
I'll be in contact if the situation changes. Proceed to assault all defense points between you and the target.
Please proceed to the shuttle bay to board the Black Talon.
Damage reports from all decks. We're holding together, sir--but I don't know for how long.
Make it last, Ensign. Don't let us down.
Make sure it's long enough, Ensign. Your life and career are at stake.
Please stand alert. Grand Moff Kilran's representatives have returned.
Please stand alert. Grand Moff Kilran's representative has returned.
I see you took care of the Republic assault. Welcome back to the bridge.
Status report?
Thank you, Captain.
Appreciated.
I am Sith, and you will address me as "my lord."
Respect your betters.
...Yes. I apologize, my lord.
You mean, "Welcome back to the bridge, sir."
Respect your superiors.
...Yes. Welcome back to the bridge, sir.
We've survived the first wave of attacks from the Brentaal Star. Things will be calm until we enter fighter range--another minute, maybe two.
Congratulations, my lord. Security reports that the sabotage droids have been destroyed.
Congratulations, sir. Security reports that the sabotage droids have been destroyed.
Status report?
I'm talented.
I don't need your praise, Lieutenant. Only your obedience.
Don't try fawning over me.
Oh, please, please don't kill us....
Shut up, Ensign, or I'll kill you myself.
Yes. Yes, of course.
We've penetrated the Brentaal Star's outer defenses. Their next assault won't come until we enter fighter range--another minute, maybe two.
Transmission coming in! Long range... it's a message, but it's not from the Brentaal Star.
Put it through, Ensign.
Let's hear.
What?
The Brentaal Star must have sent a distress signal. Someone's responding.
Yes? And?
I'll patch the message through immediately.
This is Jedi Grand Master Satele Shan hailing unidentified Imperial vessel.
I'm en route to your location with sixteen Republic vessels. I'm asking you to retreat before more lives are lost.
Your pleading is pointless, Jedi. I am Sith, and there is nothing you can do to stop me.
Fool.
I have heard those same words from others of your kind. They're never true.
Are you afraid there won't be a ship left to find? That I'll destroy your friends before you can reach me?
Mine or yours?
It is not fear I feel. I'm concerned--for you.
The Empire doesn't turn and run so easily. Your ship brought this upon itself.
This is an Imperial concern.
You can make those claims if you wish, but we both know they're lies.
All you're going to do is earn me hazard pay. You don't scare me, Jedi.
I'm sure not worried.
I'm not trying to scare you. I want you to see reason.
I'm glad to hear a voice of reason. Let us end this conflict together.
Disregard the transmission. Continue closing on the Brentaal Star.
Keep attacking, Ensign.
Understood. Maintaining course and speed.
The Brentaal Star is under my protection. Our convoy was ambushed and I sent the Star ahead. We will reunite.
I just crippled three Imperial dreadnaughts. I don't wish to destroy you--the peace between Republic and Empire is fragile enough already.
What about the stolen secrets aboard the Brentaal Star? Is the general upholding the "peace"?
I know what's on that ship.
The general can speak for himself--but I believe he does work for peace.
Tell the Brentaal Star to hand over the general. No one needs to be hurt.
All I want is one man.
The general has a role to play with the Republic.
Fragile enough to be crushed like glass. The same way I'll crush you.
Fragile like bone.
Your base aggression serves no one--not even your Empire.
Peace is a lie, Jedi. The Sith know this.
Foolish Knight.
I won't be drawn into a philosophical debate.
If you're afraid of the diplomatic consequences, why not meet us alone? Without Republic backing?
Don't hide behind "peace."
Because there are lives at stake here--not my pride.
I don't play politics. Take it somewhere else.
I'm not Imperial.
Even Mandalorians respect life. This isn't about politics.
Incidents like this are happening across the galaxy, but only because we let them. Leave the Brentaal Star to me.
If you don't, then may the Force be with you--because the men and women aboard that ship can hold you off until we arrive. And you will be defeated.
You're deluding yourself. The ship is already mine.
No, I won't.
We'll see about that. End transmission.
Close the channel.
Affirmative. Ending transmission.
You're still talking?
You've made yourself clear. But I suggest you prepare to face a Jedi--and you may want to consider what that means.
Entering fighter range. The Brentaal Star is launching its first squadron.
It's time for us to do the same. I assume you'll lead the boarding party to go after the general?
All right. All right. We're close enough to fly in and send a raiding party. I assume you're going?
Whatever's necessary to finish this.
I am.
Prepare to be amazed.
Good luck. I'm sure you'll have the general in your hands in no time.
Before you go, you should know something. Most of the marines will back you up, but we had to execute a few for refusing to fight.
We'll be awaiting your successful return.
Is there a reason your marines can't handle this?
Why me?
We suffered heavy losses in the attack. The marines can back you up, but they can't raid that ship on their own.
There's one other thing. I promised you my help, so--I brought you some supplies from the cargo bay.
Someone on Dromund Kaas may be disappointed when they don't receive the delivery, but I thought our situation took precedence.
You're doing well, Captain. Continue, and we may make it out of this.
That should help.
Great!
Thank you. We're all doing our best, here.
I don't need your sniveling, Captain. I have a task to perform.
You're pathetic.
Yes, of course. I understand.
Not enough of them in the first place. Then half were injured when the droids attacked, and we had to shoot another dozen for not fighting.
They were terrified, after what happened to the captain. They panicked.
They're dead now, anyway.
We did retrieve their equipment. It's yours. We're doing our very best to serve you, I swear.
You've done well--so far. Continue, and all will end well.
Excellent.
You're doing fine, Ensign. I'm not going to hurt you.
Don't worry.
Idiot.
Ignore him--I'll make sure he doesn't trouble you in the future.
Not enough of them in the first place, and now half of them are injured. They can back you up, but that's about it.
I advise that you proceed to the shuttle bay. The flight to the Brentaal Star may be hazardous--but Grand Moff Kilran has complete faith in your abilities.
I will supervise operations on the bridge. Please proceed to defend the Black Talon.
All marines have been neutralized. Scanning for additional threats.
What's going on? Sir....
Stay calm, Ensign. Everyone stay calm.
No threats found. The bridge is now secure.
Where's the captain?
Listen up, scum.
Hands off the consoles! We're all listening, my lord.
Hands off the consoles! You've got our attention.
I can handle this, Lieutenant.
Call the medbay. I want help for the injured--now.
We need to aid the wounded.
Acknowledged. Medical assistance will be properly rendered.
I do appreciate that.
I'm Captain Revinal Orzik; I'm pretty sure I know what this is about. For the record, I take complete responsibility for my actions.
Captain Orzik, I'm told you disobeyed a direct order from Grand Moff Kilran.
You ignored a command.
Yes. I had no idea he'd respond this brutally--he must want the Brentaal Star's passenger pretty badly. Maybe he just hates me.
I understand, Captain. If nothing else, that should make it easier on the crew.
Very admirable.
I'm glad it's worth something.
So what?
I'm not looking for a pardon. I just don't want my crew punished.
You're here because of the Moff, aren't you? He must want the Brentaal Star's passenger pretty badly. Or maybe he just hates me.
The Black Talon would be destroyed chasing a battleship. I fought in the war before, and I'll fight again--but I don't do suicide missions.
You're relieved. [Kill him.]
"Suicide" was deciding you could ignore your superiors.
You're relieved. [Kill him]
Argh!
The captain's dead. The captain's dead....
The captain's dead. The captain's dead....
Shut up. You have our attention, my lord. What would you have us do?
Shut up. You have our attention, sir. What would you have us do?
Shut up. Bounty hunter--you have our attention. What would you have us do?
Someone clean up this mess. We have business to take care of.
We have a mission.
Let this be a lesson--your only hope for survival is complete and utter loyalty.
All of you--learn from this!
Yes, my lord.
Yes, my lord.
Yes, sir.
Yes, sir.
I'm sorry it came to this. The rest of you don't have to suffer the same fate.
Let's put this behind us.
But what about--
You have your instructions.
In accordance with Article 27-A of the Imperial Code of Military Conduct, command of this vessel has been lawfully transferred.
New orders are being downloaded to your consoles. Priority one: Intercept the Brentaal Star.
The crew is yours. As second-in-command, I'll make sure of it. We were not aware of the captain's treason.
I believe you. Now let's go--we have a Republic warship to catch.
Fine.
Idiots.
We'll do our best to be more... competent in the future.
Don't double-cross me.
There won't be anymore problems. Unlike the captain, I believe in my Empire.
Brukarra! Do as the droid says and prepare to jump to lightspeed....
I'm not looking to make a martyr of anyone. We can complete this mission and survive.
This won't be suicide.
I expect you believe that. I see it differently.
Listen to me--you managed to hijack one ship, and that's certainly impressive. But taking on the Brentaal Star is something else altogether.
I might be able to get us close--but then you'd have to board it, fight an army of Republic soldiers and somehow find the general. It's unacceptable.
I didn't ask for your analysis, Captain. We're going after that ship.
I don't care what you think.
I see. Thank you for making that clear.
We don't have a choice--those were Moff Kilran's instructions. So if we're going to survive, we need to work together.
We need your help.
I see. You're as much a victim here as I am, aren't you? Damn Kilran and his fleet.
All right. I'm not ready to be branded a traitor just yet. We'll get the general. I'm not sure how, but we'll get him.
I can do it.
Should be easy.
Moff Kilran found an accomplice crazier than he is.
Seems I have very little choice in the matter. You have my crew--I'll cooperate. For now.
Let's get to work. We don't have much time.
Time to move, then.
This is for the best.
Don't cause trouble.
I'll do my best to remember that.
Downloading new orders to all bridge consoles. Priority one: Intercept the Brentaal Star.
You heard the droid, everyone. Prepare to jump to lightspeed....
Emerging from hyperspace now. One Thranta-class warship on the scanners. Powering up....
Enemy is firing! Turbolasers, missiles--and what looks like transport pods. I'm not sure....
Evasive maneuvers. Keep the pods at a distance--they look harmless, but they'll latch onto the hull and cut at us with sabotage droids.
Evasive maneuvers--aye, sir.
Sir, three shuttles on an intercept course!
An assault party. We don't have sufficient defenses to keep them from landing.
Let them land. I can handle any boarders.
I'll deal with it.
This course of action is deemed advisable.
What do you suggest we do?
Advice?
Once those vessels make it to the shuttle bay, Republic troops will swarm the Black Talon.
Imperial security forces may be insufficient to contain the enemy boarding party.
The droid's right. Once we're engaged in corridor-to-corridor fighting, we'll never get back on the offensive.
If you can get to the shuttle bay and deal with the Republic troops, we can handle things up here. Otherwise... I don't know what happens.
This'll be amusing.
Security will meet you at the entrance to the shuttle bay. Defend the ship at all costs--and we'll get you to the Brentaal Star.
The pods are a distraction. Return fire--aim for their power generators! So long as they're damaged and we're not, we have the advantage.
Lieutenant--Captain Sylas, sir. Engineering is reporting blaster fire... they just cut out.
Continue the assault. I'll deal with this.
I'll head to engineering.
This crew is becoming a disappointment. We'll have to address that some day.
The pods had soldiers, idiot.
If we weren't in the middle of battle, I'd kill you for incompetence.
The pods had soldiers, idiot.
Remind me to report your incompetence when we get to Dromund Kaas.
The pods had soldiers, idiot.
I wasn't expecting much from the Imperial military--but you are a sad bunch.
The pods had soldiers, idiot.
This'll be amusing.
Damn it. It must be some sort of boarding action.
If they're in engineering, they could destroy this ship. With due respect--I recommend you lend a hand down there.
Nobody else could.
Yes, battle!
Pathetically easy.
I'll notify security.
And don't worry. We won't let those Republic scum get away.
We must proceed to the bridge immediately.
Identity confirmed! Good day--I am advanced protocol unit NR-02. My functions are diplomacy, translation, manslaughter and calumniation.
I have an urgent message for you from my master. Please stand by for delivery.
Who's your master and how does he know I'm here?
I have questions.
Let's hear it.
What makes you think I care what your master has to say?
Why should I?
I am certain you will be interested. Anyone traveling through Imperial space must listen to my master.
This is unit NR-02 to Grand Moff Kilran. You are now in contact with the Black Talon.
Well--so I am. And it seems you've brought me just the people I've been looking for.
Well--so I am. And it seems you've brought me just the person I've been looking for.
My name is Rycus Kilran. I'm commander of the Fifth Fleet, second to the Minister of War, and--my personal favorite--the so-called "Butcher of Coruscant."
You speak to the apprentice of Darth Baras. Explain this interruption.
Talk, now!
An Imperial Grand Moff--what a delightful surprise. What can I do for you?
Hello there!
I wasn't aware that the military would be contacting me, sir--it's an unexpected honor.
This is a surprise, Moff.
No need for that. Military or Intelligence, we're all on the same side.
There a reason an Imperial big shot is interrupting my trip?
Oh yeah?
An excellent question, bounty hunter.
I don't understand. What's going on here?
What's this about?
It's apparent I need another pair of hands. So, I asked NR-02 to check the ship's passenger manifest.
My good fortune that I was in a position to contact you; I was already aboard the Black Talon.
Something wrong with the hologram? Or is your face supposed to look like that?
Well, aren't you ugly?
The scars? They're an old gift from a Jedi friend. I barely notice them anymore.
Six hours ago, the Republic engaged in an illegal border skirmish on the edges of Imperial territory. One enemy warship escaped.
That warship--the Brentaal Star--is carrying a passenger of vital strategic importance. Yours is the only vessel placed to intercept.
This passenger the Brentaal Star is carrying--who is it?
Passenger?
And my part?
I'll explain in a moment.
Too bad.
I don't believe you're right. Let me explain.
The warship's passenger is code-named "the general." We don't know his identity, but the Republic believes he possesses military secrets--our military secrets.
I trust the reports; the general must be captured or killed. Captain Orzik--the man commanding your transport--doesn't share my enthusiasm. He's disobeyed my orders to attack.
Feel free to show him what the Empire does to cowards. Then commandeer his ship, find the Brentaal Star and deal with the general.
I'll do that.
Sounds interesting, but you realize I don't work for free.
You paying?
I certainly understand--as will the Imperial treasury. We need individuals like you if we're to survive the next great war.
I'll take care of it. If you're right, it's a job that needs to be done.
Very well.
Truly, it's comforting to find patriots in this age of skirmishes and border disputes. We need individuals like you if we're to survive the next great war.
Not exactly a simple request, you know.
It's a tall order.
This is not a simple age. Our millennia-old war against the Republic simmers while we engage in skirmishes and border disputes.
Yet we cannot grow complacent. Traitors like your captain and threats like the general must be eliminated.
Right now, I'm more interested in getting to Dromund Kaas.
I have other priorities.
Oh, I can sympathize. But I'm sure I can convince Darth Baras to forgive a bit of tardiness.
Oh, I can sympathize. But I'm sure Lord Zash appreciates that the Empire comes before her research.
Oh, agent. I may not serve the Minister of Intelligence, but I'm sure he'd agree that the military needs you now.
I do sympathize. But you'll find that while you're operating in Imperial space, our needs sometimes take priority.
The general will be dead or in custody by day's end. If he's not, I assure you--your ship will never reach port.
I will lead the way to the bridge. Once Captain Orzik is deposed and our hijacking is complete, we may proceed to the Brentaal Star.
Communication with this unit is not permitted. Goodbye.
We must proceed to the bridge immediately.
If you are concerned about the loss of life, I assure you--the deaths of all injured crew members will be strategically insignificant.
Excellent. Then I will proceed.
I apologize for letting Lieutenant Sylas pursue her vendetta. She disabled my security systems before I could contact you.
However, I'm certain that the remainder of the crew now realizes the futility of resistance.
I apologize, but my systems have been damaged.
Sir, should we--
Stand down. Everyone, stand down.
You made it back after all. Seems I underestimated you--again.
You left me on the Brentaal Star to die, "Captain."
You tried to kill me.
So I did. I don't deny it.
I'm sorry it came to this, Captain. I never wanted to fight you.
I wish this hadn't happened.
Nor I, you.
Moron.
It's hard for me to argue with that.
My men will take the general to the brig. If I might have a word before you pass judgment....
I'd like a word before you pass judgment on me. I'll only take a moment.
I take full responsibility for trying to strand you. The crew only followed orders. My... misjudgment--as well as my failure--is unforgivable.
You're right. I gave you your chance, and you wasted it.
Indeed. [Kill him]
Your fate isn't for me to decide. You'll be imprisoned--along with the general--until we dock.
I'm locking you up.
Thank you for your... mercy. It was unexpected.
I apologize for letting the captain pursue his vendetta. His crew disabled my security systems before I could stop him.
It's hardly proper, contacting you this way, but urgency must supersede propriety. You see, you and your vessel are in a very special position.
I'll be in touch. NR-02? Please show the way.
The Sith Empire and the Galactic Republic have battled for millennia. We can't lose our edge during these years of skirmishes and border disputes.
To prepare for the next great war, we must purge ourselves of disloyal men like Captain Orzik and threats like the general. You agree?
It's not the grand scheme that I'm worried about. It's the details.
Partly.
I'm sure you'll work them out somehow.
Definitely.
I'm glad we could clear that up.
You want a direct answer, I'll give you one: No.
I don't.
Then perhaps I need to be clearer. Dromund Kaas is no place for those unwilling to fight.
My protocol droid can take you to the bridge and navigate to the Republic warship. The rest, I'll gladly leave up to you.
You won't interfere? I take the Black Talon and the Brentaal Star on my terms?
I decide how to handle it?
So long as the general is in our hands or a bloodstained mess by the end of it all? You have my complete confidence.
Time to act.
Looks like there's no choice.
Please hold. Now confirming your identity. This will only take a moment.
I am certain my master can answer to your satisfaction.
Transmitting signal now. Acknowledging Citadel security programs. Communications are initiated.
I'm not sure...
Captain Orzik believes that your vessel can't possibly defeat a Republic warship--and rather than hear me out, he staged a "communications malfunction."
Why? The captain must have known you wouldn't be happy.
For what reason?
You've contacted me instead of him.
So you came to me.
How? We're a transport ship in deep space.
Oh?
And you have something "very special" in mind for us?
You're planning something?
Indeed I do.
Get to it.
My--we're irritable, aren't we? Fortunately, I find impatience to be a virtue.
Grand Moff Kilran is also personally responsible for the deaths of thirteen Jedi Masters.
Please--my humility.
Security forces may be insufficient to destroy all sabotage droids before irreversible damage is inflicted.
With all due respect, I strongly recommend you lend a hand down there--or else we're all going to be floating in space.
I saw tactics like this on the eastern galactic front. If we can avoid the pods, they'll--
Maybe we have a chance against that thing after all.
It seems we got lucky. What's our position?
We're almost on top of them--we'll be in fighter range in a few minutes.
We need to get aboard that vessel.
That's our target.
What now?
We must pass through their outer defenses before attempting to seize the general. However--
This'll be amusing.
Lieutenant--Captain Sylas, sir. Those pods are latching onto the hull. We're getting damage reports.
Something's cutting into the Black Talon. We're being boarded by sabotage droids!
Master Tannar Va--it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure we can resolve this peacefully.
Let's talk this out.
With the captain gone, it's your command now. Make the call.
Lieutenant?
Of course--thank you. Put the Grand Moff through, then.
I just killed the second-in-command, and you want to know if I can report to your master?
After what just happened?
That is correct. Opening channel now.
You honor me, Master.
